Became part of The University of Montana in 1994 |type = [[public university|Public]] |dean = Barry Good |city = [[Missoula]] |state = [[Montana]] |country = [[United States|USA]] |students = |undergrad = |postgrad = |faculty = |staff = |sports = Rodeo |campus = [[University of Montana]] |website = http://www.cte.umt.edu |logo = |footnotes = }} '''The University of Montana College of Technology''' (UM COT) is the two-year college of The University of Montana, located in [[Missoula, Montana]]. The COT was founded in 1956, and became part of the [[University of Montana| University of Montana - Missoula]] in 1994. The College offers 35 programs including career, transfer and technical programs. The five academic departments include the Department of Applied Computing and Electronics, Department of Industrial Technology, Department of Applied Arts and Sciences, Department of Business Technology, and Department of Health Professions. In addition, the College provides workforce development for the region as well as dual credit courses for hundreds of high school students in the area, and works to support adults seeking new career opportunities or professional development. During the Fall 2010 semester, 2,444 students were enrolled at UM COT.http://www.cte.umt.edu/ ==Mission statement== "Our mission as the two-year college of The University of Montana is to provide open access to higher education that expands opportunities for Montana residents. We are a gateway to comprehensive education, delivering high quality, student-centered, professional technical, transfer, and workforce programs and courses."October 7, 2008. Proposed Mission Statement for The University of Montana College of Technology ==Facilities and Location== The University of Montana COT is composed of two campuses, an east and west campus, both of which are located on South Avenue in Missoula.http://www.cte.umt.edu/about/images/areamap.jpg Although the UM COT is located away from the University of Montana's main campus, it is a unit of the University of Montana and incoming UM COT freshman are exposed to the same services and expectations as students who primarily attend UM's main campus. The College's east campus is home to the administration building and health and business building, while the west campus is the home of the Department of Industrial Technology. As a whole, the UM COT consists of 200.4 acres of land.http://www.umt.edu/plan/UM%20Quick%20Facts/default.aspx The University of Montana College of Technology is one of Montana's 17 two-year colleges.http://mus.edu/twoyear/2yr_map.asp In addition to dining options on UM's main, or Mountain Campus, students can eat breakfast and lunch at the UM COT East Campus cafeteria and Hunter Dining Room or the West Campus cafeteria.http://www.cte.umt.edu/prospectivestudents/campusdining.asp [[File:CollegeOfTechnology1.jpg|thumb|University of Montana COT East Campus]] ==History== The University of Montana College of Technology was previously known as the Missoula Vocational Technical Center until it became affiliated with the University of Montana in the Fall of 1994. The name change was a sign of the school's expanding responsibilities as it became part of the University while still providing a wide variety of professional and technical programs.Report Card from the Office of the President, The University of Montana to Commissioner of Higher Education, December 1994 The school was governed by Missoula County High Schools until July 1989, when the Montana Board of Regents took over that responsibility.http://mus.edu/twoyear/QuickFacts.pdf ==Academic Departments and Programs== === Department of Applied Arts and Sciences=== Focuses on instruction in communication, science, writing, mathematics, and social science. This department oversees the Associate of Arts Degree.http://www.cte.umt.edu/appliedartsandsciences/ ===Department of Applied Computing and Electronics=== Combines the concepts of business and industry to prepare graduates to be knowledgeable and competitive in a global society. The curriculum gives graduates the ability to obtain positions related to science, technology, engineering and mathematics. The Department of Applied Computing and Electronics is a member of several organizations, including [[Cisco Networking Academy|Cisco Regional Networking Academy]] and North American Board of Certified Energy Practitioners. The department offers Certificate of Applied Science programs in Computer-Aided Design and Computer Support, as well as Associate of Applied Science Degrees in Computer Technology, Electronics Technology and Energy Technology.http://ace.cte.umt.edu/ A Bachelor of Applied Science Degree is also available to students who have completed an Associate of Applied Science Degree. ===Department of Business Technology=== The Department of Business Technology aims to work together with both local and regional businesses and industry in order to prepare graduates for work in a diverse global society. This department is the largest within the COT, covering six academic areas: Accounting Technology, Administrative Management, Culinary Arts, Management, Medical Information Technology, and Paralegal Studies.http://www.cte.umt.edu/businesstech/ Each respective program offers an Associate of Applied Science Degree or certificate upon completion. ===Department of Health Professions=== This department prepares students to become health practitioners who can skillfully operate in a variety of medical settings. The department offers Associate of Applied Science Degrees in Medical Assisting, Practical Nursing, Radiologic Technology, Respiratory Care, and Surgical Technology. The department also offers an Associate of Science Degree in Registered Nursing and a certificate in Pharmacy Technology. The Medical Assisting program is currently under review, however, and is not accepting new students at this time.http://www.cte.umt.edu/health/ ===Department of Industrial Technology=== The Department of Industrial Technology is located on the COT's west campus. The department encompasses six programs: Building Maintenance Engineering, Carpentry, Diesel Equipment Technology, Heavy Equipment Operation, Recreational Power Equipment, and Welding Technology. The Building Maintenance Engineering, Heavy Equipment Operation, and Recreational Power Equipment programs are one-year programs that offer a Certificate of Applied Science upon completion. The Carpentry and Welding Technology programs both offer either a one-year Certificate of Applied Science or a two-year Associate of Applied Science Degree upon completion, while the Diesel Equipment Technology is a two-year program that offers only an Associate of Applied Science Degree.http://www.cte.umt.edu/industrialtech/ ===Outreach Program=== A notable feature of the University of Montana COT is the Outreach Program, a program that offers individuals who are unable to attend daytime or structured classes an opportunity to fulfill requirements despite a busy schedule. Online courses, evening and weekend classes, short courses, summer programs and other options are available.http://www.cte.umt.edu/outreach/ ==Achievements and Recognition== *In a recent [[Missoula Independent]] article, the Hunter Dining Room on the COT East Campus was called "Missoula's best-kept dining secret."http://missoulanews.bigskypress.com/gyrobase/kitchen-confidential/Content?oid=1332080&storyPage=1 *Culinary Arts/Foods Services Management graduate Carol Chandler earned the 2007 Student Culinarian of the Year award.http://doclibrary.com/MFR1644/DOC/Sizzle-StudentCulinarianoftheYeararticle20071629.pdf *In 2008, Culinary Program Director Thomas Campbell received a Certificate of Appreciation during the [[American Culinary Federation]] Western Regional Conference.http://www.acfchefs.org/download/media/20080424a.pdf *COT Satellite campuses and programs described as a "superior programming model" by the Accreditation Review Committee for Surgical Technologists. ==References== ==External links== *[http://www.cte.umt.edu/ Official website] *[http://www.umt.edu/future.aspx University of Montana website] {{coord missing|Montana}} {{University of Montana}} {{Missoula, Montana}} {{DEFAULTSORT:University Of Montana College Of Technology}} [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Schools and colleges of the University of Montana]]
